verses.text: Be not thou envious against evil men, Neither desire to be with them.
For their heart studieth destruction, And their lips talk of mischief.
Through wisdom is a house builded; And by understanding it is established:
And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled \add With\add* all precious and pleasant riches.
A wise man \add is\add* strong; Yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: And in multitude of counsellers \add there is\add* safety.
Wisdom \add is too\add* high for a fool: He openeth not his mouth in the gate.
He that deviseth to do evil Shall be called a mischievous person.
The thought of foolishness \add is\add* sin: And the scorner \add is\add* an abomination to men.
\add If\add* thou faint in the day of adversity, Thy strength \add is\add* small.
If thou forbear to deliver \add them that are\add* drawn unto death, And \add those that are\add* ready to be slain;

If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; Doth not he that pondereth the heart consider \add it?\add* And he that keepeth thy soul, doth \add not\add* he know \add it?\add* And shall \add not\add* he render to \add every\add* man according to his works?
My son, eat thou honey, because \add it is\add* good; And the honeycomb, \add which is\add* sweet to thy taste:
So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: When thou hast found \add it\add*, then there shall be a reward, And thy expectation shall not be cut off.
Lay not wait, O wicked \add man\add*, against the dwelling of the righteous; Spoil not his resting place:
For a just \add man\add* falleth seven \add times\add*, and riseth up \add again:\add* But the wicked shall fall into mischief.
Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, And let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:
Lest the \sc Lord\sc* see \add it\add*, and it displease him, And he turn away his wrath from him.
Fret not thyself because of evil \add men\add*, Neither be thou envious at the wicked;
For there shall be no reward to the evil \add man;\add* The candle of the wicked shall be put out.
My son, fear thou the \sc Lord\sc* and the king: \add And\add* meddle not with them that are given to change:
For their calamity shall rise suddenly; And who knoweth the ruin of them both?
These \add things\add* also \add belong\add* to the wise. \add It is\add* not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
He that saith unto the wicked, Thou \add art\add* righteous; Him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:
But to them that rebuke \add him\add* shall be delight, And a good blessing shall come upon them.
\add Every man\add* shall kiss \add his\add* lips That giveth a right answer.
Prepare thy work without, And make it fit for thyself in the field; And afterwards build thine house.
Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; And deceive not with thy lips.
Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.
I went by the field of the slothful, And by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
And lo, it was all grown over \add with\add* thorns, \add And\add* nettles had covered the face thereof, And the stone wall thereof was broken down.
Then I saw, \add and\add* considered \add it\add* well: I looked upon \add it, and\add* received instruction.
\add Yet\add* a little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep:
So shall thy poverty come \add as\add* one that travelleth; And thy want as an armed man.
